item.title: Sublime: Overriding default file type/Assigning specific files to a file type
item.description: I've been using Sublime a bit recently and one thing I wanted to do was put neo4j cypher queries into files with arbitrary extensions and have them recognised as cypher files every time I open them. I'm using the cypher Sublime plugin to get the syntax highlighting but since I've got my cypher in a .haml file it only remembers that it should have cypher highlighting as long as the file is open.

item.title: Sublime: Getting Textmate's Reveal/Select in Side Bar (Cmd + Ctrl + R)
item.description: After coming across this post about why you should use Sublime Text I decided to try using it a bit more and one of the things that I missed from Textmate was the way you can select the current file on the sidebar. In Textmate the shortcut to do that is 'Cmd + Ctrl + R' so I wanted to be able to do something similar or configure Sublime so it responded to the same shortcut.
